Posts.Content: Note that a decision to stop taking a med causing too much side effects is different from a decision to not even start taking it, which seems to be case if I understood correctly.  I do support a decision to stop taking meds that clearly is generating more harm than good, but I don't support a decision to not even try.
Posts.Title: Decided not to take Arimidex & Oncologist not happy

Posts.Content: Been there, done that: (X) Thinking that everything suspicious can be cancer (X) Crying days after getting the diagnostic (X) Obsessing with a prognosis much worse than warranted by the cancer findings
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed

Posts.Content: Chances are statistically defined for populations; for you, what matters is yours being malignant or not. If there is a way to know that now, go for it, but otherwise just remain vigilant as any other aspects of one's health.
Posts.Title: new calcifications on screening mammogram
